title: Decision-theoretic rough sets
summary: In the mathematical theory of decisions, decision-theoretic rough sets (DTRS) is a probabilistic extension of rough set classification.  First created in 1990 by Dr. Yiyu Yao,[1] the extension makes use of loss functions to derive α {\displaystyle \textstyle \alpha } and β {\displaystyle \textstyle \beta } region parameters. Like rough sets, the lower and upper approximations of a set are used.
